page.title: 18Tim Fitzgeorge-Parker
page.content: One of the people who enjoys the peace and isolation of an old Cotswold farmhouse is author Tim Fitzgeorge Parker. With 17 books to his credit he is a writer well-known in equestrian circles. In his time he has trained horses at Lambourn and ridden steeplechasers. He was for 12 years chief racing correspondent of the Daily Mail. He is often called upon to write obituaries of famous personalities. He chose his home because of its position, being central to the race-courses and stud farms of England. He runs a firm publicising bloodstock and stud farms. As a young man he joined the Royal Scots Greys and won the Military Cross at the battle of Salerno. Major Fitzgeorge-Parker is married with two children.
